channel.title: Javascript image changer (by link) (with out refreshing the page)
channel.description:
Wel thats what i need for my website i could take it out of tip.it/runescape, site but im not realy sure i want to just in case i miss some thing :S so if any body could show me the basic layout or a link to a html tip site about my request that would be grate.
Here is the link that the javascript image changer is used on
i need this so i can make a slide show (basicly) of images with out having to load up the rest of the site agen for each image :S
Thanks

item.title: Javascript image changer (by link) (with out refreshing the page)
item.dc:creator: @kloplop321 kloplop321
item.description:
@kloplop321 wrote:

I was just making an example of what you meant, because for inexperianced html coders, they may do something just stupid like <img src=“document.getElementById(“image”);”>id=image1 or something. I just didn’t make a whole html script that is all.

Read full topic

item.title: Javascript image changer (by link) (with out refreshing the page)
item.dc:creator: @marluxia marluxia
item.description:
@marluxia wrote:

^^^^^ yea something like…

<head>
<script language="Javascript" type="text/javascript">
var theImage = document.getElementById("image");
theImage.setAttribute("src", "something_else.jpg");
</script>
</head>

<body>
<img id="image" src="something.jpg" />
</body>

yea just cannablised from one of my old things

Read full topic

even though I barely know javascript, but I know the logic of it, I think that would be about right, and I think you would add id=‘image1’ in the but I am not totally sure.
